forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind 12 to 31 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the tender hours of the morning, Downtown San Francisco is draped in a veil of cloud, the sky heavy with the promise of rain. Outside, the air feels damp and carries the sharp tang of the sea, beckoning from the undulating contours of the bay. The city is set to rouse in a hush, as the soft thrum of raindrops will soon echo against the pavement. Temperatures are nestled around a cool 54, urging the first stirrings of the day to seek solace in cozy layers. The persistent south wind, playfully gusting at intervals, makes its presence known, adding a brisk serenity to the morning air.

As the clouds deepen throughout the day, the inevitable touch of rain will envelop this vibrant metropolis. The high will nudge towards a cool 59, eventually giving way to a languid fall to 56 as the afternoon progresses. Dressing wisely means layering—think a warm scarf and a dependable raincoat. This is the kind of day that calls for quiet contemplation; a walk through the raindrop-kissed streets could serve as a reprieve from the bustling rhythm of ordinary life. One might find delight in a local café, sipping on something warm while watching the world drift by through the window, or perhaps lose themselves in a good book at home, as the rhythmic patter of rain creates its own gentle symphony.
